items.q: What is tariff.ai and how does it save me money?
items.a: tariff.ai is an AI-powered platform that analyzes tariffs, duties, and trade regulations across 190+ countries. It saves you money by identifying the most cost-effective classification codes, alerting you to available trade agreements, and preventing costly compliance errors.

items.q: How accurate is the HS code classification?
items.a: Our AI achieves 98% accuracy in HS code classification, verified against official customs databases. Each classification includes a confidence score and detailed reasoning, so you can verify the logic behind every recommendation.

items.q: Does the system consider Free Trade Agreements (FTAs)?
items.a: Absolutely. tariff.ai automatically identifies tax-saving opportunities based on trade agreements between countries (like Israel-Europe or US agreements), and indicates which documents are required to claim the duty exemption.

items.q: How frequently is the data updated?
items.a: Our database is updated in real-time with direct connections to government databases in 190+ countries. You'll always have access to the latest tariff rates and regulatory changes.

items.q: Can the system be integrated into our corporate ERP?
items.a: Yes, we offer API access for enterprise customers, allowing seamless integration with your existing ERP, WMS, or customs management systems. Contact our sales team for integration details.

items.q: Is my information and searches kept confidential?
items.a: Absolutely. We take data security seriously. All data is encrypted in transit and at rest, and we never share your search history or business data with third parties. See our Privacy Policy for complete details.

items.q: What's the difference between a regular HS code search and your analysis?
items.a: Unlike basic HS code lookup tools, our analysis provides complete trade intelligence: duties, taxes, regulations, compliance requirements, FTA opportunities, alternative classifications, and confidence scores - all in one comprehensive report.

items.q: Which countries are supported by the system?
items.a: tariff.ai covers 190+ countries and territories, including all major trading nations. Our coverage includes the US, EU member states, UK, China, Japan, and most other countries involved in international trade.
Yes! You can try tariff.ai for free with one complimentary report. This gives you a chance to experience our AI classification and see the value before committing to a paid plan.

items.q: How do I get support for professional questions?
items.a: Our support team is available via email at hello@tariff.ai. Enterprise customers receive priority support with dedicated account managers and faster response times.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.intro: Understanding how we use cookies and similar technologies on tariff.ai

sections.title: 1. Data Controller
sections.content:
tariff.ai ("we", "our", "us") is the data controller responsible for your personal information. You can contact us at:
Email: info@tariff-ai.com
Address: tariff.ai Privacy Team, San Francisco, CA
For GDPR-related inquiries, our EU representative can be contacted at info@tariff-ai.com

sections.title: 2. Information We Collect
sections.content:
We collect the following types of personal data:

2.1 Information You Provide:
• Account Information: Full name, email address, company name
• Newsletter Subscriptions: Email address, consent timestamp
• Contact Forms: Name, email, company, subject, message

2.2 Information Collected Automatically:
• Analytics Data: Page views, page URLs, referrer URLs, session IDs
• Device Information: IP address (anonymized after 90 days), browser type, operating system, device type, screen resolution
• Location Data: Country and city (derived from IP address)
• Interaction Data: Clicks, form submissions, scroll depth, element interactions, viewport size
• Technical Data: User agent, language preferences, timezone

2.3 Cookies and Tracking:
• Essential Cookies: Session management (necessary for functionality)
• Analytics Cookies: Usage patterns and site performance (requires consent)
• Marketing Cookies: User preferences for marketing communications (requires consent)
For detailed cookie information, see our Cookie Policy.

sections.title: 3. Legal Basis for Processing
sections.content:
Under GDPR and LGPD, we process your personal data based on:
• Consent: Newsletter subscriptions, analytics cookies, marketing communications (you may withdraw consent at any time)
• Contractual Necessity: Account management and service delivery
• Legitimate Interests: Site security, fraud prevention, product improvements (balanced against your privacy rights)
• Legal Obligations: Compliance with tax, accounting, and other legal requirements

sections.title: 4. How We Use Your Information
sections.content:
We use your personal data for the following purposes:
• Service Delivery: Provide tariff analysis reports, maintain your account, process transactions
• Communication: Respond to inquiries, send service updates, deliver newsletters (with consent)
• Analytics & Improvement: Understand usage patterns, optimize user experience, develop new features
• Security: Detect and prevent fraud, abuse, and security incidents
• Compliance: Meet legal and regulatory obligations

We do NOT:
• Sell your personal data to third parties
• Use your data for automated decision-making that significantly affects you
• Process sensitive personal data (health, biometric, political opinions) without explicit consent

sections.title: 5. Information Sharing and Third Parties
sections.content:
We share your personal data only in the following circumstances:
• Service Providers: Base44 Platform (infrastructure and hosting), Email Service Providers, Payment Processors
• Legal Requirements: We may disclose your data if required by law, court order, or to protect our legal rights.
• Business Transfers: In the event of a merger or acquisition, your data may be transferred to the new entity, subject to the same privacy protections.

We do NOT sell, rent, or trade your personal data.

sections.title: 6. International Data Transfers
sections.content:
Your data may be transferred to and processed in countries outside your residence, including the United States.
For EU users: We ensure adequate protection through Standard Contractual Clauses (SCCs) approved by the European Commission.
For Brazilian users (LGPD): We comply with cross-border transfer requirements and implement appropriate safeguards.

sections.title: 7. Data Retention
sections.content:
We retain your personal data only as long as necessary:
• Account Data: Duration of account + 90 days after closure
• Analytics Data: 12 months from collection
• Newsletter Subscriptions: Until you unsubscribe + 30 days
• Contact Form Submissions: 24 months after last interaction
• Consent Records: 3 years (for compliance proof)
• Financial Records: 7 years (legal requirement)

After retention periods expire, data is permanently deleted or anonymized.

sections.title: 8. Data Security
sections.content:
We implement industry-standard security measures:
• Encryption: Data encrypted in transit (TLS/SSL) and at rest (AES-256)
• Access Control: Role-based access, principle of least privilege
• Authentication: Multi-factor authentication for administrative access
• Monitoring: 24/7 security monitoring and incident response
• Regular Audits: Periodic security assessments and penetration testing

While we take every reasonable precaution, no system is 100% secure. We will notify you of any data breaches as required by law.

sections.title: 9. Your Rights (GDPR & LGPD)
sections.content:
You have the following rights regarding your personal data:
• Be Informed: This policy explains our practices
• Give or Withdraw Consent
• Access Your Data
• Delete Data
• Object to Processing

To exercise these rights, use the Data Request Form below or contact info@tariff-ai.com

sections.title: 10. Children's Privacy
sections.content: Our services are not intended for individuals under 18 years of age. We do not knowingly collect personal data from children. If we discover we have collected data from a child, we will delete it immediately. Parents or guardians who believe we may have collected data from a child should contact us at info@tariff-ai.com

sections.title: 11. Automated Decision-Making
sections.content: We do not use automated decision-making or profiling that produces legal or similarly significant effects on you. Any analytics or personalization features are used solely to improve user experience and can be opted out of via cookie preferences.

sections.title: 12. Marketing Communications
sections.content:
With your consent, we may send you:
• Product updates and new features
• Industry insights and educational content
• Special offers and promotions

You can opt out at any time by:
• Clicking "unsubscribe" in any email
• Updating your account preferences

sections.title: 13. Data Breach Notification

In the event of a data breach that poses a risk to your rights and freedoms, we will:

• Inform affected individuals without undue delay
• Provide information about the nature of the breach and remedial actions

We may update this Privacy Policy periodically to reflect changes in our practices or legal requirements. We will:

cookiePolicy.title: Cookie Policy
cookiePolicy.intro: Understanding how we use cookies and similar technologies on tariff.ai

sections.title: 1. What Are Cookies
sections.content:
Cookies are small text files stored on your device (computer, tablet, or mobile phone) when you visit a website. They help websites remember your preferences, understand how you use them, and provide a better user experience.

Key Characteristics:
• Text files (not programs or viruses)
• Store information about your visit
• Can be deleted or blocked at any time
• Come in different types with different purposes

sections.title: 2. How We Use Cookies
sections.content:
tariff.ai uses cookies for the following purposes:

Essential Functions:
• Maintain your logged-in session
• Remember your language and theme preferences
• Secure your connection to our services

Analytics & Performance:
• Understand which pages are most popular
• Analyze user behavior to improve our service
• Track technical errors and bugs

User Experience:
• Remember your cookie consent preferences
• Personalize content based on your interests
• Optimize site performance

sections.title: 3. Types of Cookies We Use
sections.content:
3.1 Essential Cookies (Always Active)
These cookies are necessary for the website to function and cannot be disabled.
• Session Management: Keeps you logged in as you navigate
• Security: Protects against CSRF and other attacks
• Load Balancing: Distributes traffic across servers
Examples: session_id, csrf_token, auth_state

3.2 Analytics Cookies (Requires Consent)
Help us understand how visitors interact with our website.
• Page Views: Track which pages are visited (PageView entity)
• User Actions: Monitor clicks, form submissions (UserAction entity)
• Session Data: Analyze user journey
Examples: Google Analytics

3.3 Marketing Cookies (Requires Consent)
Used to deliver relevant advertisements and measure campaign effectiveness.
• Ad Targeting: Show relevant ads based on interests
• Conversion Tracking: Measure effectiveness of campaigns
Examples: Facebook Pixel, Google Ads

sections.title: 4. Cookie Duration
sections.content:
Session Cookies (Temporary): These cookies expire when you close your browser.
Purpose: Maintain active session, navigation state.

Persistent Cookies (Long-term): These cookies remain on your device for a specified period.
• Short-term: 24 hours to 30 days (analytics)
• Medium-term: 30 days to 1 year (preferences)
• Long-term: 1-2 years (consent records)

sections.title: 5. Cookies We Use - Detailed List
sections.content:
Essential Cookies:
• session_id: User session management (Session, First-party)
• analytics_session_id: Analytics tracking ID (12 months, First-party)
• cookie_consent: Stores consent preferences (1 year, First-party)

Analytics Cookies (with consent):
• Page tracking: Records page views (12 months, First-party)
• Action tracking: Records user interactions (12 months, First-party)
• Session data: Tracks user sessions (30 minutes, First-party)

sections.title: 6. Third-Party Cookies
sections.content:
Currently, tariff.ai minimizes the use of third-party cookies. However, we may use:
• Base44 Platform (Infrastructure Provider): Essential for application functionality
• Future Third-Party Services: If we integrate additional services (analytics, payment processors), we will update this policy.

sections.title: 7. Managing Your Cookie Preferences
sections.content:
7.1 Through Our Cookie Banner: You can customize your preferences when you first visit the site or through the settings.

7.2 Through Your Browser: All modern browsers allow you to control cookies:
• Google Chrome: Settings → Privacy and security → Cookies
• Mozilla Firefox: Settings → Privacy & Security
• Safari: Preferences → Privacy
• Microsoft Edge: Settings → Cookies and site permissions

sections.title: 8. Disabling Cookies - Impact
sections.content:
If You Disable All Cookies:
• Cannot stay logged in
• Settings and preferences won't be saved
• Some features may not work

If You Disable Only Non-Essential Cookies:
• Website will function normally
• You'll stay logged in
• We won't be able to improve the site based on usage data

sections.title: 9. Do Not Track (DNT)
sections.content: Some browsers offer a "Do Not Track" (DNT) signal. We respect your cookie consent choices through our banner. DNT signals are not universally standardized.

sections.title: 10. Data Collected Through Cookies
sections.content:
The data collected through cookies includes:
• Device Information: IP address, Browser type, Operating system
• Usage Information: Pages visited, Time spent, Clicks
• Technical Information: Language preference, Timezone

sections.title: 11. Your Rights (GDPR & LGPD)
sections.content:
You have the following rights regarding your personal data:
• Be Informed: This policy explains our practices
• Give or Withdraw Consent: Control usage of cookies
• Access Your Data: Request info on stored cookies
• Delete Data: Request deletion of cookie data
• Object to Processing: Opt out of non-essential cookies

sections.title: 12. International Users
sections.content:
For EU Users (GDPR): We obtain explicit consent before non-essential cookies. You can withdraw consent at any time.
For Brazilian Users (LGPD): We obtain consent for non-essential cookies. You have the right to revoke consent.

sections.title: 13. Updates to This Cookie Policy
sections.content: We may update this Cookie Policy to reflect changes in technology or cookie usage. We will post the updated policy on this page. The "Last Updated" date will change.
